definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]

sentences.english: All Darwin perceived was that selection must work in nature, too.
sentences.chinese: 達爾文所理解的也就是自然選擇，物競天擇。

sentences.english: Can natural selection explain human personality?
sentences.chinese: 物競天擇是否能解釋人的性格？

sentences.english: Natural selection favors those genotypes that manage to produce and rear successfully the most offspring.
sentences.chinese: 天擇藉由不同基因型而產生及培育大多數成功的子代。

sentences.english: Is it part of the natural selection process?
sentences.chinese: 適者生存是物競天擇過程中的一部分嗎？

sentences.english: Natural selection has favored certain defenses against cancer but cannot eliminate it altogether.
sentences.chinese: 天擇產生某些對抗癌症的方法，但未能完全消弭癌症。

sentences.english: As asserted by Darwin, only the fittest can survive.
sentences.chinese: 正如達爾文所言，物競天擇，適者生存。

sentences.english: Natural selection favors genes that allow children to draw as much nourishment from their mothers as possible.
sentences.chinese: 天擇偏好讓幼兒儘可能從母親身上得到養份的基因。

sentences.english: Evolution, the theory goes, guarantees survival to the fittest.

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
Miscellaneous School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) whose leading advocate was Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
